data.title: Black History - February 22nd
data.meta_description: February 22nd Cultivate self-confidence, self-esteem and a better outlook on life. You are apt to be pessimistic.
data.text:
February 22nd

Cultivate self-confidence, self-esteem and a better outlook on life. You are apt to be pessimistic. You are capable of great things if you will accept the present happiness and not worry about the future. You are generous to a fault and can love deeply.

1839 Octavius Catto, educator who was killed by Irish men to prevent him from voting in Philadelphia was born in Charleston, SC.

1841 Grafton Tyler Brown, artist, lithographer and the first African American whose paintings were collected by the Oakland (CA) Museum of Art was born in Harrisburg, PA.

1881 James Reese Europe, bandleader who organized the Clef Club was born in Mobile, AL.

1888 James Maxie Ponder, first African American admitted to practice at Mercy Hospital in St Petersburg, Florida. Was born in Jacksonville, FL.

1888 Horace Pippin, self taught artist whose work is burned into oak panels was born in West Chester, PA.

1903 Graham W. Jackson, pianist, organist and choral director, was born in Portsmouth, VA.

1907 Rex William Stewart jazz cornetist with the Duke Ellington orchestra was born in Philadelphia, PA.

1911 Frances Ellen Watkins Harper, author, poet and the first African American woman to publish a novel (Iola Leary) dies in Philadelphia, PA.

1913 (George Holmes) Buddy Tate, saxophonist was born in Sherman TX.

1922 (Joseph Benjamin) Joe Wilder, jazz trumpeter and bandleader was born in Colwyn, PA.

1928 (Clarence Edward Smith) Clarence 13X, founder of the five-Percent National was born in Danville, VA.

1928 Lawrence Joel, US Army Sergeant First Class and the first living African American to receive the Medal of Honor since the Spanish-American War was born in Winston-Salem, NC.

1930 Charles Owens, professional golfer was born in Winter Haven, FL.

1930 Arthur Turner Bharucha-Reid, mathematical biologist was born in Hampton, VA.

1932 (Gilbert Edward) Gil Noble, television reporter and interviewer (Like It Is) was born Harlem, NY.

1936 John Hope, educator and political activist was born in Augusta, GA.

1936 (Ernest Kador, Jr.) Ernie K-Doe, singer (Mother-In-Law) was born in New Orleans, LA.

1937 George Fleming, member of the Rose Bowl Hall of Fame and member of the Washington State House of Representatives was born in Dallas, TX.

1938 Bobby Hendricks, lead singer with The Drifter (Drip Drop) was born in Columbus, OH.

1938 Ishmael Scott Reed, poet (Mumbo Jumbo) was born in Chattanooga, TN.

1940 (Chester) Chet Walker, National Basketball Association player was born in Benton Harbor, MI.

1942 Robert ‘Big Sonny’ Edwards, singer with the Intruders, was born in Philadelphia, PA.

1943 Cordell Hull Reagon, founding member of The Freedom Singers of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee and a leader of the Albany Movement was born in Nashville, TN.

1943 Roy Roberts, blues musician, singer and songwriter was born in Livingston, TN.

1944 Tucker Smallwood, actor (The Cotton Club) was born in Washington, DC.

1947 Harvey Mason, Sr., jazz drummer was born in Atlantic City, NJ.

1950 (Julius Winfield) “Dr. J” Erving, National Basketball Association player was born in Roosevelt, NY.

1952 Kermit DeKoven Johnson, National Football League player was born in Los Angeles, CA.

1952 Albert Bryant, Jr., US Army brigadier general was born in Pine Bluff, AR.

1953 Gloria Bromell Tinubu, educator and the first African American woman to earn a MS and Ph.D. in Agricultural Economics from Clemson University was born in Georgetown County, SC.

1955 Gordon ‘Gyutar’ Banks, guitarist was born in Norfolk, VA.

1957 Sharen Davis, costume designer (Ray and Dreamgirls) was born.

1962 Lenda Murray, professional bodybuilding champion was born in Detroit, MI.

1963 Devon Eugene Malcolm, professional cricketer was born in Kingston Jamaica.

1963 Tracy Maxwell Heard, first African American Woman majority leader in the Ohio House of Representatives was born in Columbus, OH.

1965 Eric Girard Yelding, Major League Baseball player was born in Montrose, AL.

1968 Rodney Whitaker, jazz double bass player and educator was born in Detroit, MI.

1968 Jayson Williams, National Basketball Association player was born in Ritter, SC.

1971 Alfonzo Blackwell, jazz saxophonist, pianist, bassist, guitarist and drummer was born in Brooklyn, NY.

1971 Rico Rodrigus Mack, National Football League player was born in Statham, GA.

1976 Florence Ballard, singer with The Supremes, dies in Detroit, MI.

1977 Na Orlando Brown, National Football League player was born in Reidsville, NC.

1978 Dhani Makalani Jones, National Football League player was born in San Diego, CA.

1980 Courtney Van Buren, National Football League player was born in St. Louis, MO.

1980 Shamari Fears-DeVoe, lead singer with Blaque was born in Detroit, MI.

1982 (Floyd Nathaniel Hills) Danja, hip-hop record producer was born in Virginia Beach, VA.

1983 Kimberly Nicole Morgan, Miss Mississippi 2007 and singer was born in Oxford, MS.

1987 Ryan Scott, sprinter runner (100 meters) was born in Bristol, England.

2000 (William) Wee Gee Howard, singer with The Dramatics (Whatcha See is Whatcha Get) dies.

2002 Jones Malheiro Savimbi, founder of the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola dies in Lucusse, Moxico Province, Angola.

2005 (Reginald Henry) Reggie Roby, National Football League player dies in Nashville, TN.

2011 (William Hargis Bowman) Beau Dollar, vocalist and drummer dies in Cincinnati, OH.
